did.abstract: Principally correspondence dealing with the manufacture of ammunition by Joseph Reid Anderson and Dr. Carmichael for Fortress Monroe and the armory at Harper's Ferry, Va. (now W. Va.), 1850-1851. Also included are a letter of 1803 from Daniel Huger, secretary of state, to the South Carolina legislature requesting an appropriation for the repair of the building where the records were kept; an indenture, 1824; a letter from John P. Martin discussing the problems of the mail and stage service; and letter, 1862, of Huger to Josiah Tattnall concerning military and naval operations in Virginia.
